wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core.operation

Class ImageConvertIJ

  • java.lang.Object
    • wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.wrappers.imagej.core.operation.ImageConvertIJ
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageConvert

    public class ImageConvertIJ
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageConvert
    General Interface implementation to convert from and to other usual image formats.

    • Method Detail

      • addSLiceFromAwtImage

        public ImageCoreIJ addSLiceFromAwtImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Adds a slice to an image using an java.awt.Image. The image underlying this instance must be non empty (at least depth one). The length of the input array must agree with the depth (number of slices) of this image. The width and height of each image in the input array must agree with the width and height of this image. The bit depth of the AWT image must agree with the bit depth of this image. The memory policy is that the reference of the input image is used to recycle the memory for pixels of the input image in the new slice. Duplicate the input image if this behavior is not the right one.
        Specified by:
        addSLiceFromAwtImage in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - An image as AWT Image instance to add a slice to an image core.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.addSLiceFromAwtImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage)

      • initializeFromAwtImages

        public ImageCoreIJ initializeFromAwtImages(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] bufferedImages)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Initializes the values of the image underlying this instance using an array of java.awt.Image. The length of the input array must agree with the depth (number of slices) of this image. The width and height of each image in the input array must agree with the width and height of this image. At last, the bit depth of all input AWT images must agree with the bit depth of this image.
        Specified by:
        initializeFromAwtImages in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        bufferedImages - An array of image as AWT Image instance to initialize slices of an image core.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.initializeFromAwtImages(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[])

      • createFromAwtImages

        public static ImageCoreIJ createFromAwtImages(java.awt.image.BufferedImage[] bufferedImages)
        Converts an array of java.awt.Image to an ImageCore. The returned image has only one slice.
        Parameters:
        bufferedImages - An array of image as AWT Image instance to initialize slices of an image core.
        Returns:
        The image as an ImageCore implementer's instance.

      • getSliceAsAwtImage

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage getSliceAsAwtImage(int zCoord)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Retrieves a slice of this instance as an AWT BufferedImage. The data of the slice is copied into a newly allocated low level buffer.
        Specified by:
        getSliceAsAwtImage in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        zCoord - The depth coordinate from which to extract a slice
        Returns:
        The BufferredImage representing the slice at depth zCoord
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.getSliceAsAwtImage(int)

      • getSliceAsRawArray

        public java.lang.Object getSliceAsRawArray(int zCoord)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Retrieves a slice of this instance as an Array of gray level values. The array gives the reference of the slice data so that the values of the slice can be modified through the returned Array. Depending on the Bit Depth (8 or 16), the array can be an instance of byte[] or short[]. The data of the slice is NOT copied into a newly allocated low level buffer.
        Specified by:
        getSliceAsRawArray in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        zCoord - The depth coordinate from which to extract a slice
        Returns:
        An Object which is either instance of byte[] or short[] and provides the reference to the slice's raw Array (buffer) of gray levels.
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.getSliceAsRawArray(int)

      • setSliceFromAwtImage

        public ImageCoreIJ setSliceFromAwtImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage bufferedImage,
                                        int zCoord)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Copies an java.awt.Image to an ImageCore slice. The width and height of this instance and the AWT image must agree.
        Specified by:
        setSliceFromAwtImage in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        bufferedImage - An array of image as AWT Image instance to initialize slices of an image core.
        zCoord - The depth coordinate for which a slice should be initialized.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.setSliceFromAwtImage(java.awt.image.BufferedImage, int)

      • projectionTomography

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage projectionTomography(CoordinateAxis axis,
                                                         boolean maximizeContrast)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Creates a 2D image with each pixel color equal to the average of gray levels along a line parallel to a coordinate axis which projects onto that pixel.
        Specified by:
        projectionTomography in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis along which to project
        maximizeContrast - If true, the gray scales in the output image should be scaled so as to maximize contrast among possible colors. A Blurring filter is also applied before scaling.
        Returns:
        The 2D image with pixel's gray levels averaging the image along one direction.
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.projectionTomography(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.CoordinateAxis, boolean)

      • projectionVolumeRendering

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage projectionVolumeRendering(CoordinateAxis axis,
                                                              boolean maximizeContrast)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Creates a 2D image with each pixel color equal to the maximum of all gray levels along a line parallel to a coordinate axis which projects onto that pixel.
        Specified by:
        projectionVolumeRendering in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        axis - The axis along which to project
        maximizeContrast - If true, the gray scales in the output image should be scaled so as to maximize contrast among possible colors. A Blurring filter is also applied before scaling.
        Returns:
        The 2D image with pixel's gray levels averaging the image along one direction.
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.projectionVolumeRendering(wrapScienceJ.wrapImaJ.core.CoordinateAxis, boolean)

      • getRegularShortArray

        public short[][] getRegularShortArray()
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Converts the image to a regular array of short. The integer values of gray levels are unchanged. If the image has type GRAY16, the memory of this instance is recycled and the resulting array references the very slice pixels arrays of this image. Use ImageCore.duplicate() if this is not the right behavior.
        Specified by:
        getRegularShortArray in interface ImageConvert
        Returns:
        A regular array of short representing the voxel's gray levels.
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.getRegularShortArray()

      • getRegularByteArray

        public byte[][] getRegularByteArray()
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Converts the image to a regular array of bytes. The integer values of gray levels are unchanged if the input image has type GRAY8. The integer values of gray levels are left unchanged if the input image has type GRAY16, so that overflows might happen in general. If the image has type GRAY8, the memory of this instance is recycled and the resulting array references the very slice pixels arrays of this image. Use ImageCore.duplicate() if this is not the right behavior.
        Specified by:
        getRegularByteArray in interface ImageConvert
        Returns:
        A regular array of bytes representing the voxel's gray levels.
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.getRegularByteArray()

      • addSliceFromArray

        public ImageCoreIJ addSliceFromArray(short[] shortArray,
                                     int bitDepth)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Adds a slice to an image using an array of short. The image underlying this instance cannot be empty and must have at least one slice.
        Specified by:
        addSliceFromArray in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        shortArray - A 2D image as a one-dimensional buffer to add a slice to an image core.
        bitDepth - The number of bits per voxel of the new image (values are truncated in case of overflow).
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.addSliceFromArray(short[], int)

      • createFromRegularArray

        public static ImageCoreIJ createFromRegularArray(short[][] voxelValues,
                                                 int width,
                                                 int bitDepth)
        Converts an array of voxel values to an ImageCore. The size of the array, which is an array of 2D image values, must be the same as (or larger than) the size of the image which generated this instance. The memory from voxelValues is recycled into the new image if bitDepth is 16. Otherwise, bitDepth must be 8, the memory from voxelValues is left unchanged and a new byte image is allocated.
        Parameters:
        voxelValues - A 3D array containing the values of the image.
        width - Width of each slice of the image to create (the height is obtained through width and voxelValues[0].length, which must exist and be multiple of width.
        bitDepth - The number of bits per voxel of the new image (values are truncated in case of overflow).
        Returns:
        The image as an ImageCore implementer's instance.

      • addSliceFromArray

        public ImageCoreIJ addSliceFromArray(byte[] byteArray,
                                     int bitDepth)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Adds a slice to an image using an array of byte. The image underlying this instance cannot be empty and must have at least one slice.
        Specified by:
        addSliceFromArray in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        byteArray - A 2D image as a one-dimensional buffer to add a slice to an image core.
        bitDepth - The number of bits per voxel of the new image
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.addSliceFromArray(byte[], int)

      • createFromRegularArray

        public static ImageCoreIJ createFromRegularArray(byte[][] voxelValues,
                                                 int width,
                                                 int bitDepth)
        Converts an array of voxel values to an ImageCore. The size of the array, which is an array of 2D image values, must be the same as (or larger than) the size of the image which generated this instance. The memory from voxelValues is recycled into the new image if bitDepth is 8. Otherwise, bitDepth must be 16, the memory from voxelValues is left unchanged and their values are copied (embedded) as is into a newly created image.
        Parameters:
        voxelValues - A 3D array containing the values of the image.
        width - Width of each slice of the image to create (the height is obtained through width and voxelValues[0].length, which must exist and be multiple of width.
        bitDepth - The number of bits per voxel of the new image
        Returns:
        The image as an ImageCore implementer's instance.

      • convertToGray8

        public ImageCoreIJ convertToGray8(boolean scaleMaxContrast)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Converts the image to one Byte gray levels (colors from 0 to 255) The method is NOT assumed to preserve the original image and the returned reference could be this if the pixel's formats are already 8bits per voxel.
        Specified by:
        convertToGray8 in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        scaleMaxContrast - If true, all values are scaled so that the values range is maximal before reducing quantization resolution. otherwise, the values are divided by 256.
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.convertToGray8(boolean)

      • convertToGray8Clamp

        public ImageCoreIJ convertToGray8Clamp()
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Converts the image to one Byte gray levels (colors from 0 to 255) The method is NOT assumed to preserve the original image and the returned reference could be this if if the pixel's formats are already 8bits per voxel. The values of gray levels are clamped and set to 255 for the voxels with values greater than 255.
        Specified by:
        convertToGray8Clamp in interface ImageConvert
        Returns:
        The image underlying this instance to allow for use of the Cascade Pattern
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.convertToGray8Clamp()

      • getCopyAsGray8

        public ImageCoreIJ getCopyAsGray8(boolean scaleMaxContrast)
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Copies the image to one Byte gray levels (colors from 0 to 255) The method is assumed to preserve the original image and a new image is created in all cases.
        Specified by:
        getCopyAsGray8 in interface ImageConvert
        Parameters:
        scaleMaxContrast - If true, all values are scaled so that the values range is maximal before reducing quantization resolution. otherwise, the values are divided by 256.
        Returns:
        The new image with Gray8 values format
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.getCopyAsGray8(boolean)

      • getCopyAsGray8Clamp

        public ImageCoreIJ getCopyAsGray8Clamp()
        Description copied from interface: ImageConvert
        Copies the image to one Byte gray levels (colors from 0 to 255) The method is assumed to preserve the original image and a new image is created in all cases. The values of gray levels are clamped and set to 255 for the voxels with values greater than 255.
        Specified by:
        getCopyAsGray8Clamp in interface ImageConvert
        Returns:
        The new image with Gray8 values format
        See Also:
        ImageConvert.getCopyAsGray8Clamp()
